revised_title: Comparative Study of Ganglia Position in Three Scorpion Species
tldr: The author examines the differences in the position of the ganglia of the ventral nerve-cord in three species of scorpions. They compare the ganglia arrangement and innervation of the pulmonary sacs in Androctonus funestus, Scorpio cyaneus, and Scorpio Italicus. The study reveals important anatomical differences between scorpions with triangular and pentagonal sternums.
